result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick J Smits was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 25 years bifurcated sentence.  CORRECTED 08-29-2016:  Severity class for Ct. 1 corrected to Felony B.
Concurrent with: present sentence & revocation

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with recovery program. No contact with the victim A. V. (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co defendant C.P. (person, property, residence or family). Mental health treatment with a therapist. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.    Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
